alert.note: Alert for Anchorage; Matanuska Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 25 at 5:23AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...PERIODS OF LIGHT RAIN EXPECT THIS MORNING FOR ANCHORAGE AND THE MATANUSKA VALLEY... Expect light rain to develop across the Anchorage and Matanuska Valley this morning. Air temperatures are around or above the freezing mark, so freezing rain is unlikely. However, sometimes adding water on top of ice and snow covered roadways can create just as slick conditions as freezing rain. Use extra caution if you are headed out and about on area sidewalks and roadways this morning and leave extra time to reach your destination. Gusty south winds will develop this afternoon, causing temperatures to once again rise into the upper 30s to around 40. Some wind will linger through Thursday morning, so temperatures for much of the area will remain above freezing all the way through Thursday. Temperatures will then drop well below freezing Thursday night, causing any remaining water to refreeze.
